SurfaceData
Control
public
ChartSharp.​SurfaceData

This class is used to represent the data displayed in a SurfaceChart. The data is handed over to a SurfaceChart via XAML. You can add data to a chart in code by adding an instance of this class to the property Items of an instance of SurfaceChart.

Functions
SurfaceData
public SurfaceData()

Initializes all properties to their default values.

Properties
DrawStyle
public PresentationStyle DrawStyle { get; set }

Affects the form of the rendering of the surface.  Possible values are:

  • Lines: Represents Points as a surface grid.

  • Area: Represents Points as a surface area. The polygons(Triangles) making up the surface are shaded flat.

Default Value

Lines

Fill
public Brush Fill { get; set }

A Brush, used to fill rendered shapes. If DrawStyle is either Area, this property is used as the Brush to paint the polygons of the surface. If it is Lines, this property is ignored.

Default Value

SolidColorBrush(Colors.Gray)

Outline
public Brush Outline { get; set }

A Brush, used to render the outline of shapes. If DrawStyle is Lines, this property is used as the Brush for the surface grid. If it is Area, this property is ignored.

Default Value

SolidColorsBrush(Colors.Black)

Points
public double[,] Points { get; set }

The collection of Points used for a SurfaceChart. The first dimension represents the X-Direction, and the second dimension the Z-Direction. The distance between points in the X- and Z-Direction is uniformly adjusted, depending on the SurfaceChart.MinX, SurfaceChart.MaxX, SurfaceChart.MinY and SurfaceChart.MaxY. E.g. if the interval in X is [0;1] and the first dimension has a size of 10; the distance between each points is 0,1.

Default Value

null

Thickness
public double Thickness { get; set }

Specifies the thickness of lines in a grid. Only applies if DrawStyle is Lines.

Default Value

1
